title.narrative: SANGJOG

description.narrative: A program for better SRHR for young people vulnerable to HIV in Bangladesh. The goal of the program is to Increased access to integrated SRHR & HIV services to vulnerable young key people. The objectives are following: 1. Increase awareness and health seeking behavior of 50,000 vulnerable young key people on SHR &HIV services. 2. Establish functional referral linkage with GoB and NGO health facilities for providing SRHR and HIV services to 25,000 VYKPs. 3. Increase capacity of 20 Government services facilities for providing integrated SRH and HIV services. 4. Advocacy for creating enabling environment sensitizing 300 stakeholders for increasing access of VYKPs to SRHR &HIV information and services. The target group of the the project will address SRHR and HIV needs of Vulnerable Young Key People (VYKP), who are street children/pavement dwellers, transport workers, floating sex workers, young people engaged in small trade and work as labor
